arm_group.description: 20 minutes real transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS)
20 minutes sham transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether a new medical technology can temporarily
      alter pain perception.  The new techonologyis call Transcranial direct current stimulation
      (tDCS).

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation ( HD-DCS) on Pain Perception

detailed_description.textblock:
Healthy subjects will complete questionnaires and undergo a laboratory pain assessment
      before and after a 20 minute session of real or sham tDCS.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  100 Health Individuals recruited from Charleston ,SC

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Can not be pregnant

          -  No history of Depression, chronic pain, Seizers, suicidal inplaned metal devices,
             history of brain surgery, loss of consciousness.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation ( HD-DCS) on Pain Perception

primary_outcome.description: Participants will undergo comprehensive laboratory pain assessment including hot and cold, sensory and pain threshold assessment using the Method of Limits with the Pathway Thermo-sensory Analyzer System (Medoc Inc., NC) which is specifically designed for assessing laboratory pain perception.
primary_outcome.measure: Effects of tDCS on pain perception
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of the study visit, approximately 2 hours

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate the painfulness and unpleasantness of each thermal stimulus using a custom-developed computerized visual analogue scale (VAS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of the study visit, approximately 2 hours

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
